name: Arthur's conjectures
rephrased: The conjectures map representations of reductive groups over local fields to automorphic representations via the Langlands program.
implication_form: If the conjectures hold, then the unitary representations predicted by the Langlands dual group exist and relate to automorphic forms.
explained: Arthur's conjectures, formulated for reductive groups over global and local fields, propose a precise description of the automorphic representations contributing to the spectral decomposition of the relative trace formula derived from the Arthur-Selberg trace formula. They predict that these representations are deeply controlled by the Langlands dual group and its conjugacy classes, providing a framework to relate automorphic representations to Galois representations and vice versa, thereby extending the global Langlands program.
related_conjectures: Fundamental Lemma (proved by Ngô Bao Châu)
